patterns.name: Wolf
patterns.description: The shortest PBA Animal pattern. Requires extreme precision and strong ball control. Named for its aggressive, predatory nature that punishes errant shots.

patterns.name: Cheetah
patterns.description: A short, fast-playing pattern that demands accuracy. Like its namesake, this pattern is quick and unforgiving.

patterns.name: Viper
patterns.description: A venomous short pattern with tricky oil distribution. Strikes back at bowlers who miss their marks.

patterns.name: Chameleon
patterns.description: A medium-length pattern that changes character as it breaks down. Requires adaptation throughout competition.

patterns.name: Bear
patterns.description: A powerful medium pattern that rewards strength and rev rate. The heavier oil volume demands aggressive equipment.

patterns.name: Scorpion
patterns.description: A stinging medium-length pattern with a flat oil distribution. Known for its ability to humble even the best bowlers.

patterns.name: Dragon
patterns.description: A long, intimidating pattern that breathes fire on misses. Requires power and precision to conquer.

patterns.name: Shark
patterns.description: The longest PBA Animal pattern. A predator that lurks in deep oil, demanding the most from bowlers' arsenals.

patterns.name: Del Ballard Jr
patterns.description: Hall of Fame pattern honoring Del Ballard Jr. A challenging short pattern requiring touch and accuracy.

patterns.name: Johnny Petraglia
patterns.description: Hall of Fame pattern honoring Johnny Petraglia. A transitional length that challenges shot-making.

patterns.name: Mike Aulby
patterns.description: Hall of Fame pattern honoring Mike Aulby. Rewards the versatility that made Aulby a legend.

patterns.name: Don Carter
patterns.description: Hall of Fame pattern honoring Don Carter, the first PBA star. A classic medium pattern.

patterns.name: Don Johnson
patterns.description: Hall of Fame pattern honoring Don Johnson. A balanced medium-length challenge.

patterns.name: Marshall Holman
patterns.description: Hall of Fame pattern honoring Marshall Holman. Tests the intensity that defined Holman's career.

patterns.name: Mark Roth
patterns.description: Hall of Fame pattern honoring Mark Roth. Rewards the power game that Roth pioneered.

patterns.name: Earl Anthony
patterns.description: Hall of Fame pattern honoring Earl Anthony. Demands the smooth, consistent style of the greatest lefty.

patterns.name: Carmen Salvino
patterns.description: Hall of Fame pattern honoring Carmen Salvino. A long pattern requiring the showmanship Salvino brought to bowling.

patterns.name: Billy Hardwick
patterns.description: Hall of Fame pattern honoring Billy Hardwick. Tests the complete game that made Hardwick a champion.

patterns.name: Dick Weber
patterns.description: Hall of Fame pattern honoring Dick Weber. A long, demanding pattern befitting the sport's ambassador.

patterns.name: Typical House Shot
patterns.description: Standard recreational center pattern with high ratio (10:1). Provides forgiveness and easier scoring conditions for casual bowlers.

patterns.name: Kegel Easy Street
patterns.description: A high-ratio house pattern designed by Kegel. Very forgiving with strong recovery from outside shots.

patterns.name: Kegel Main Street
patterns.description: A moderate house pattern by Kegel. Slightly more challenging than typical house shots while remaining accessible.
